summary: An email from an FBI NY CART Coordinator to an FBI recipient providing a rough inventory and status update of electronic devices seized in connection with the Epstein investigation. It details devices sent for unlocking, imaged, processed, encrypted, or pending review, noting that nothing has been reviewed pending a taint review.

persons.name: FBI NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: Author of the email providing a status update on electronic items processed by CART in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein CART items status update
events.description: An FBI NY CART Coordinator emails a status report on electronic devices seized in the Epstein investigation, detailing items processed, imaged, encrypted, and pending review.

keyFacts: As of August 9, 2019, numerous electronic items were seized in the Epstein investigation, including 3 iPads and 1 iPhone sent for unlocking, and 1 iMac locked and not imaged.
One external hard drive was imaged but encrypted, and multiple other devices (iMacs, Windows boxes, a laptop, and loose media) were imaged and processed or pending processing.
No data from the seized electronic items had been reviewed as of the email date, pending a taint review.
The email indicates an impending search was about to be conducted, suggesting ongoing investigative activity.
